column5: get em online while you can price goes up to 200 nov1 and 260 dec 1, for all the sled heads out there
Sorry for hijacking - do I need one if I do ice fish only? Sorry for asking - just bought my first sled. Thanks
you don't need a trail pass but you do need the license sticker and insurance even if you are just using it on the lake. Kerry
The moral of the story is to always have a tip-up and a spoon while sledding
$260!!! DAYUM!!! That's a lot of cake!!!

$260!!! DAYUM!!! That's a lot of cake!!!  its actually a pretty darn good value if you take advantage of the what the trails have to offer. I.e. not use the trail to ride 2k and then go fishing.  My father and I spend countless hours riding the trails all over the province. The grooming and maintenance of the system is expensive, but riding highway like trails through the middle of the bush across ontario for 200 bucks is really a good value.  We also donate every year to our local clubs fundraiser as well.
I'm with you Ark...I ride 3,000 km a year, Michigan and Ontario trail passes
Thank you guys - I do have a valid license sticker and insurance, I guess I am good.
2 early permits for my son and myself. I too thinks it a good price. Over 6000kms for both of us last season.

Hope u gets lots of snow, enjoy I agree, the price is fair, only 2 fill ups for my truck, trails are awesome back there and yes they cant be groomed for free, up here they try to groom the trails in town, but once outside the limits look out for rocks, your on your own, best sledding here is just on the lakes

Hope u gets lots of snow, enjoy I agree, the price is fair, only 2 fill ups for my truck, trails are awesome back there and yes they cant be groomed for free, up here they try to groom the trails in town, but once outside the limits look out for rocks, your on your own, best sledding here is just on the lakes  exactly!  I ride trails out in loring all the time and they are 2 lanes wide and like a highway.
